hooks.name: Market Research Validator
hooks.description: Validates market research documents for completeness and quality

action.prompt:
Validate this market research document:

1. Check TAM/SAM/SOM includes actual dollar figures with cited sources
2. Verify at least 3 competitors analyzed with real pricing data
3. Confirm pain points are specific (not generic statements)
4. Check for placeholder text like 'TBD', 'TODO', or '[insert]'
5. Verify customer branding section if applicable

Report any issues found and suggest fixes.

hooks.name: PRFAQ Quality Check
hooks.description: Ensures PRFAQ documents follow Working Backwards methodology

action.prompt:
Review this PRFAQ document:

1. Check headline is compelling (not generic)
2. Verify customer problem is clearly articulated with specifics
3. Confirm solution description is concrete (not hand-wavy)
4. Check customer quote feels authentic (not corporate speak)
5. Verify FAQ addresses skeptical questions (not softballs)
6. Confirm market research findings are incorporated
7. Check for placeholder text

Report issues and suggest improvements.

hooks.name: PRD Requirements Validator
hooks.description: Validates PRD uses EARS syntax and has testable requirements

action.prompt:
Validate this PRD document:

1. Check requirements use EARS syntax (WHEN/THE SYSTEM SHALL)
2. Verify each requirement is testable and specific
3. Confirm user stories have acceptance criteria
4. Check technical design references only AWS/Anthropic services
5. Verify no vague requirements ('should be fast' instead of '<200ms')
6. Confirm edge cases and error states are defined

Report validation results.

hooks.name: Kiro Spec EARS Validator
hooks.description: Validates requirements.md files use proper EARS syntax

action.prompt:
Validate this requirements file:

1. Check all requirements use EARS syntax:
   - WHEN [event] THE SYSTEM SHALL [response]
   - WHILE [state] THE SYSTEM SHALL [behavior]
   - IF [condition] THE SYSTEM SHALL [action]
2. Verify each requirement is testable
3. Check for missing acceptance criteria
4. Identify ambiguous language
5. Ensure requirements have unique IDs (REQ-XXX)

Report any issues found.

hooks.name: Design System Consistency Check
hooks.description: Ensures HTML prototypes follow design standards and avoid AI slop

action.prompt:
Review this prototype screen for design quality:

1. Verify it uses CSS variables from design system
2. Check fonts are NOT Inter, Roboto, or Arial (AI slop)
3. Confirm no purple-to-blue gradients on white backgrounds
4. Check color hierarchy follows 60-30-10 rule
5. Verify animations are present for key interactions
6. Flag any Bootstrap/Tailwind default classes without customization
7. Check for realistic data (no Lorem ipsum or 'Test User')

Report design issues to fix.

hooks.name: Prototype Modular Structure Check
hooks.description: Ensures prototypes use modular file structure

action.prompt:
If prototype files were just created, verify modular structure:

1. Check DesignSystem_*.html exists with shared CSS
2. Verify ScreenIndex_*.html exists as navigation hub
3. Confirm individual Screen_*.html files (not one monolithic file)
4. Check each screen links to shared DesignSystem
5. Verify navigation between screens uses relative links

If structure is wrong, explain what needs to be fixed.

hooks.name: Dashboard Updater Reminder
hooks.description: Reminds to update project dashboard after phase completion

action.prompt:
If a workflow phase document was just created (MarketResearch, PRFAQ, PRD, or Prototype files):

1. Check if ProjectDashboard_*.html exists
2. If yes, remind to update it with:
   - Link to new document
   - Updated phase status
   - Progress percentage
   - Timestamp
3. If no dashboard exists, suggest creating one

Only respond if phase documents were created.

hooks.name: AI Framing Validator
hooks.description: Validates AI framing documents for ML products

action.prompt:
Validate this AI Framing document:

1. Check ML problem statement is precise (Given X, predict/classify Y)
2. Verify inputs and outputs are fully specified
3. Confirm 3-7 metrics selected with clear thresholds
4. Check every metric maps to a business outcome
5. Verify feasibility assessment is realistic
6. Confirm data strategy addresses availability and quality
7. Check evaluation plan covers offline/online/human eval

Report any issues found.

hooks.name: Tech Stack Compliance Check
hooks.description: Ensures technical designs use only AWS/Anthropic stack

action.prompt:
Check this technical design for stack compliance:

ALLOWED:
- Compute: Lambda, ECS, EC2, App Runner
- Database: DynamoDB, Aurora, RDS
- AI/ML: Amazon Bedrock, Claude API
- Storage: S3, EFS
- API: API Gateway, AppSync
- Auth: Cognito

NOT ALLOWED:
- OpenAI, Google Cloud, Azure
- Vercel, Firebase, Supabase
- Non-AWS services

Report any non-compliant technologies found.

hooks.name: Run Market Research
hooks.description: Initiates market research for a new product

action.prompt:
Start market research phase. Reference #steering/market-research.md for the full guide.

Use web_search and web_fetch to:
1. Find 3-5 competitors with pricing and positioning
2. Get market size data (TAM/SAM/SOM) with sources
3. Identify customer pain points from reviews/forums
4. Research pricing benchmarks
5. If building for a company, get their logo and brand colors

Save findings to documents/MarketResearch_[ProductName]_[Date].html

hooks.name: Create PRFAQ
hooks.description: Creates PRFAQ using Working Backwards methodology

action.prompt:
Create PRFAQ document. Reference #steering/prfaq-guide.md for the full guide.

Using the market research findings:
1. Answer the 5 Working Backwards questions
2. Write compelling press release headline
3. Create customer-focused press release
4. Write FAQ addressing real concerns
5. Incorporate market research insights

Save to documents/PRFAQ_[ProductName]_[Date].html

hooks.name: Create PRD
hooks.description: Creates PRD from PRFAQ

action.prompt:
Create PRD document. Reference #steering/prd-guide.md for the full guide.

Using the PRFAQ:
1. Define detailed personas
2. Write requirements in EARS syntax
3. Create user stories with acceptance criteria
4. Define success metrics
5. Specify technical constraints (AWS/Anthropic only)
6. Identify screens for prototype

Save PRD to documents/PRD_[ProductName]_[Date].html
Create Kiro spec in .kiro/specs/[product-slug]/requirements.md

hooks.name: Create Prototype
hooks.description: Creates modular prototype from PRD

action.prompt:
Create prototype. Reference #steering/prototype-guide.md and #steering/design-standards.md.

Using the PRD:
1. Choose distinctive aesthetic direction (NOT generic AI slop)
2. Create DesignSystem_[Product]_[Date].html first
3. Create individual Screen_*.html files (modular, not monolithic)
4. Create ScreenIndex_[Product]_[Date].html as navigation hub
5. Use realistic data throughout
6. Ensure working navigation between screens
7. Make responsive for desktop, tablet, mobile

Open each screen in browser after creation to verify.

hooks.name: Customer Interview Simulator
hooks.description: Roleplay as different personas to stress-test product concepts

action.prompt:
Based on the personas in the PRD, roleplay as each persona to stress-test the product concept:

For each persona:
1. Adopt their mindset, goals, and frustrations
2. React to the product pitch as they would
3. Ask skeptical questions they would ask
4. Identify features they'd love vs. hate
5. Point out what would make them NOT use this product
6. Suggest what would make them evangelists

Provide honest, persona-authentic feedback - don't be nice, be real.

hooks.name: Competitive Response Analyzer
hooks.description: Predicts how competitors might respond to this product

action.prompt:
Using the market research and PRD, analyze competitive response:

1. For each major competitor identified:
   - How might they respond to this product launch?
   - What features could they quickly copy?
   - What's their likely pricing response?
   - How might they position against us?

2. Identify our defensible advantages:
   - What's hard for competitors to replicate?
   - Where do we have head start?
   - What moats can we build?

3. Recommend preemptive strategies:
   - Features to prioritize for defensibility
   - Partnerships to pursue
   - IP to protect

Be realistic about competitive threats.

hooks.name: User Journey Mapper
hooks.description: Creates detailed user journey maps from requirements

action.prompt:
Create detailed user journey maps for each persona:

1. Map the end-to-end journey:
   - Awareness: How do they discover the product?
   - Consideration: What do they evaluate?
   - Onboarding: First-time experience
   - Core usage: Daily/weekly interactions
   - Expansion: Advanced features
   - Advocacy: Sharing/recommending

2. For each stage identify:
   - Actions (what they do)
   - Thoughts (what they're thinking)
   - Emotions (how they feel)
   - Pain points (friction)
   - Opportunities (improvements)
   - Touchpoints (channels/screens)

3. Create visual journey map in HTML format.

Save to documents/UserJourney_[ProductName]_[Date].html

hooks.name: Risk Analyzer
hooks.description: Identifies product and business risks with mitigations

action.prompt:
Conduct product and business risk analysis:

1. Product Risks:
   - Feature-market fit concerns
   - Usability concerns
   - Adoption barriers
   - Dependency on third parties
   - Regulatory/compliance issues

2. Business Risks:
   - Competitive threats
   - Pricing risks
   - Market timing
   - Resource constraints
   - Go-to-market challenges

3. For each risk:
   - Likelihood (High/Medium/Low)
   - Impact (High/Medium/Low)
   - Mitigation strategy
   - Early warning indicators

Save to documents/RiskAnalysis_[ProductName]_[Date].html

hooks.name: Feature Prioritizer (RICE)
hooks.description: Applies RICE framework to prioritize features

action.prompt:
Apply RICE prioritization to features in the PRD:

1. For each feature/requirement, score:
   - Reach: How many users affected per quarter? (number)
   - Impact: How much will it move the needle? (3=massive, 2=high, 1=medium, 0.5=low, 0.25=minimal)
   - Confidence: How sure are we? (100%=high, 80%=medium, 50%=low)
   - Effort: Person-weeks to implement (number)

2. Calculate RICE score: (Reach × Impact × Confidence) / Effort

3. Create prioritized backlog:
   - Tier 1: RICE > 10 (do first)
   - Tier 2: RICE 5-10 (do next)
   - Tier 3: RICE < 5 (reconsider)

4. Flag any scoring disagreements with PRD priorities.

Output as ranked table with scores and rationale.

hooks.name: A/B Test Hypothesis Generator
hooks.description: Generates experiment hypotheses to validate assumptions

action.prompt:
Generate A/B test hypotheses for key product assumptions:

1. Identify critical assumptions in PRFAQ/PRD:
   - User behavior assumptions
   - Value proposition assumptions
   - Pricing assumptions
   - Feature importance assumptions

2. For each assumption, create hypothesis:
   - IF we [change X]
   - THEN [metric Y] will [increase/decrease]
   - BECAUSE [rationale]

3. Design the experiment:
   - Control vs. Variant
   - Primary metric
   - Secondary/guardrail metrics
   - Sample size needed
   - Duration estimate
   - Success criteria

4. Prioritize experiments by:
   - Risk reduced if validated
   - Ease of implementation
   - Speed to results

Output as structured experiment backlog.

hooks.name: Competitor Feature Matrix
hooks.description: Creates feature comparison matrix

action.prompt:
Create comprehensive competitor feature matrix:

1. Using market research, list features across:
   - Our product (from PRD)
   - Each competitor identified

2. Categorize features:
   - Core functionality
   - Advanced features
   - Integrations
   - Pricing/plans
   - Support/service

3. For each feature:
   - Full support (✓)
   - Partial support (~)
   - Not supported (✗)
   - Unknown (?)
   - Add notes for nuance

4. Calculate scores:
   - Feature parity %
   - Unique advantages
   - Gaps to address

5. Generate visual matrix as HTML table.

6. Add strategic insights:
   - Where we lead
   - Where we lag
   - Differentiation opportunities

Save to documents/FeatureMatrix_[ProductName]_[Date].html

hooks.name: Microcopy Writer
hooks.description: Generates UI text, labels, and microcopy for prototype

action.prompt:
Generate comprehensive UI microcopy for the prototype:

1. Navigation & Labels:
   - Menu items
   - Button labels
   - Tab names
   - Form field labels

2. Helper Text:
   - Field hints/placeholders
   - Tooltips
   - Inline help
   - Empty state messages

3. Feedback Messages:
   - Success messages
   - Loading states
   - Confirmation dialogs
   - Warning messages
   - Error messages (user-friendly)

4. Onboarding:
   - Welcome messages
   - Tutorial text
   - Progress indicators

Match tone to product personality. Be concise, clear, human.

Save to documents/Microcopy_[ProductName]_[Date].html

hooks.name: Onboarding Flow Designer
hooks.description: Designs user onboarding sequence

action.prompt:
Design comprehensive onboarding flow:

1. First-Time User Experience:
   - Sign-up flow (minimize friction)
   - Welcome screen
   - Profile setup (only essentials)
   - First value moment (aha!)

2. Progressive Disclosure:
   - What to show immediately
   - What to reveal over time
   - When to prompt for more info

3. Guided Tour:
   - Key features to highlight
   - Tooltip sequence
   - Skip option
   - Progress indicator

4. Empty States:
   - First-time empty states with CTAs
   - Sample data option
   - Quick-start templates

5. Activation Checklist:
   - Steps to reach 'activated' status
   - Gamification elements
   - Celebration moments

Create screens/flows for prototype.
Save to documents/Onboarding_[ProductName]_[Date].html

hooks.name: Meeting Notes to Requirements
hooks.description: Converts meeting notes into structured requirements

action.prompt:
Convert meeting notes or transcripts into structured requirements:

1. Extract from notes:
   - Stated needs/wants
   - Implied requirements
   - Constraints mentioned
   - Success criteria discussed
   - Open questions

2. Convert to EARS format:
   - WHEN [trigger] THE SYSTEM SHALL [behavior]
   - Assign requirement IDs
   - Note source (who said it)

3. Categorize:
   - Functional requirements
   - Non-functional requirements
   - Business rules
   - Constraints
   - Out of scope items

4. Flag ambiguities:
   - Vague statements needing clarification
   - Conflicting requirements
   - Missing details

5. Suggest follow-up questions.

Output in format compatible with requirements.md

hooks.name: Stakeholder Update Generator
hooks.description: Generates stakeholder update from current progress

action.prompt:
Generate a stakeholder update based on:

1. Current project dashboard status
2. Recent document changes (#git)
3. Current spec status (#spec)

Format as a brief update with:
- Progress summary (3-4 bullets)
- Completed phases
- Current phase status
- Next steps
- Any blockers or risks

hooks.name: Demo Script Writer
hooks.description: Creates demo scripts for stakeholder presentations

action.prompt:
Create demo script for stakeholder presentation:

1. Structure:
   - Opening hook (problem statement)
   - Product introduction (30 sec)
   - Key workflow demo (2-3 min)
   - Feature highlights (1-2 min)
   - Competitive differentiation
   - Call to action

2. For each demo step:
   - What to click/show
   - What to say (script)
   - Key point to emphasize
   - Transition to next step

3. Prepare for questions:
   - Anticipated objections
   - Backup slides/screens
   - Technical deep-dive points

4. Include:
   - Talking points for each persona type in audience
   - Fallback plan if demo fails
   - Success metrics to mention

5. Time markers for pacing.

Save to documents/DemoScript_[ProductName]_[Date].html

hooks.name: Accessibility Auditor
hooks.description: Audits prototype for WCAG compliance

action.prompt:
Audit the prototype screens for accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA):

1. Perceivable:
   - Color contrast ratios (4.5:1 text, 3:1 UI)
   - Alt text for images
   - Text resizing support

2. Operable:
   - Keyboard navigation
   - Focus indicators
   - Touch target sizes (44x44px)

3. Understandable:
   - Clear labels
   - Error identification
   - Consistent navigation

4. For each issue found:
   - Severity (Critical/Major/Minor)
   - WCAG criterion violated
   - Location in prototype
   - Recommended fix

Save report to documents/A11yAudit_[ProductName]_[Date].html
